summary: Raleigh is the capital and the second-largest city in North Carolina. It is named after Sir Walter Raleigh and is known for its oak trees, earning the nickname "City of Oaks." With a population of over 460,000 (as of 2020), it is one of the fastest-growing U.S. cities. Raleigh is home to North Carolina State University and is part of the Research Triangle, a major tech and research hub. The city was planned and established in 1792 as the state capital and has a rich history, including its role during the American Revolution and Civil War.
title: Raleigh, North Carolina
